intro: Collabium yunnanense, commonly known as the Yunnan collabium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and similar plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories or on rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
